intro: Laurentia micrantha var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved laurentia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
